name: Curd Rice
history: Curd Rice, also known as 'Thayir Sadam' in South India, is a popular comfort food. It's a simple dish where cooked rice is mixed with curd (yogurt) and then tempered with spices. It's known for its cooling effect and digestibility.
description: Curd Rice is a traditional South Indian dish made by combining cooked rice with curd (yogurt) and a tempering of mustard seeds, curry leaves, and other spices. It's often garnished with coriander and served chilled.

instructions.title: Mash the Rice
instructions.description: Slightly mash the cooked rice while it's still warm. Let it cool to room temperature.

instructions.title: Mix Rice with Curd
instructions.description: In a bowl, combine the cooled rice with curd and milk. Add salt to taste. Mix well to achieve a creamy consistency.

instructions.title: Prepare the Tempering
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and urad dal. When the mustard seeds start to splutter, add chopped green chilies, ginger, and curry leaves. SautÃ© for a few seconds.

instructions.title: Combine and Garnish
instructions.description: Pour the tempering over the curd rice mixture. Add chopped coriander leaves and mix gently.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Curd Rice chilled or at room temperature. It can be garnished with additional coriander leaves or pomegranate seeds.

tips: Using slightly overcooked rice can give a softer texture to the dish.
Adjust the amount of milk to get your desired consistency.
variations: Add grated cucumber or carrot for a refreshing twist.
For a spicier version, include finely chopped green chilies in the tempering.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: No reheating required. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
presentationTips: Serve in a bowl with a spoonful of pickle or chutney on the side.
Garnish with fresh herbs or edible flowers for an elegant look.
